favourite.article: Lord,I would clasp Thy hand in mine because I want You to lead me. You are a faithful God.

Oh blessed thoughts to arise this morning with this song ringing in my soul...HE LEADETH ME!! A blessed assurance that He will do and continue to do as I am a faithful follower! Thank you for being a vessel of provision in providing these precious songs of Heaven!!! Blessings!!!
Lovely song.
His leading is the most blessed peace. Wonderful song. My childhood favourite.

How comforting it is to know that the HOLY SPIRIT leads us. HE woke me up this morning with this song in my heart I couldn't find it in my hymnal so I googled it. It was just so refreshing for me as I sang this song beginning my day knowing that the Holy SPIRIT leadeth me. He's our Guide, Comforter, Shield, Deliverer, Provider, Strong Tower, Redeemer and Saviour who leads us through the valley and restores our souls. If you do not yet received JESUS CHRIST as your LORD AND SAVIOR I'm inviting you to do so now that you too will have that confidence that someone is leading you through life's journey. THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR HELPING ME TO Find THE SONG THAT WOKE ME UP. My SOUL WAS REFRESHED.

This is my favourite hymn. It stirs my soul anytime I listen to it. O how sweet it is to trust Christ for salvation and knowing you are truly saved as a result of that. Friends, if you haven't done that yet, you've just got the next minute to do so. Heaven is real as well as Hell. Trust Jesus Christ today for Salvation and thou, shall be saved.

The Holy Spirit often puts a song in my head and heart at very low times and I find myself singing it while quietly doing housework. I will run to look up all verses to see what message I need to receive from the beautiful hymn. I haven't heard this hymn in 30 years. The verses are so pertinent for me today. Thank You God for the Holy Spirit that comforts and leads us.
I have really wanted to know the words. Thanks.
Awesome, even death's cold wave I will not flee 'cos I've got Jesus.
Awesome
I love this verse very much. Lord, I would clasp Thy hand in mine, Nor ever murmur or repine; Content, whatever lot I see, Since it is Thou that leadest me.

God leads us even through difficult, seemingly unbearable path but if only we can trust Him enough to put our hands in His hand He will lead us through the wilderness to pasture green (expected end) for He alone knows the way through the wilderness all we have to do is to follow. Most times the other side seem greener but, as faithful followers we must learn to say "though the other side seem greener but where You've kept for me is good enough for me.
All I Can Say Is Thank You to my Father above and keep this site going. I remember this song as a boy growing up in a great bible teaching church.

Whatever I do, wherever I be. Still 'tis Christ hand that leadeth me. By waters still, o'er troubled be. Still 'tis His hands that leadeth me. Are inspiring and uplifting to whenever I am weak and stranded.
Reading Psalm 23:2 and listening to the tunes and reading the song, I am indeed blessed. He indeed leadeth me to cool waters.

Besides pastoring several Baptist congregations, Gilmore served as a secretary to his father, the governor of New Hampshire. He was also a professor of English literature and Hebrew. --------------------------- On March 26, 1862, after speaking on Psalm 23 he quickly wrote down this hymn and handed it to his wife, after which he thought no more about it. 3 years later, in a Baptist Church in Rochester, NY, he opened one of their hymnbooks and saw his hymn printed there. This was the first time that he knew his hymn had gained acceptance by others. This is the only hymn of his which has maintained popularity. - Songs of the Spirit by Martin ------------------------ The original last line of the song says: Since God through Jordan leadeth me.
I don't know He Leadeth Me Lyric Choir Version.... Can you help me find the lyric?
God is so wonderful and whenever He leadeth us we are sure of a secured destiny. Blessed be the name of the Lord!

Verses 1 & 3 helped me this morning. Sometimes when I see a brother loses his job or when I see another failing in his health, I am quick to say that they should turn to the Lord. However, when I am experiencing spiritual disappointments, it is so easy for me to murmur and bemoan my state. But realizing that He leadeth us even to spiritual disappointments, job loss, health failures, etc, this makes me glad in Him and even to praise Him. "Lord, I would like to be 'content, whatever lot I see', 'whatever I do, wherever I be' because You leadeth us".
Even death's cold wave I will not flee since Thou in triumph leadest me. So inspiring a song.
I always feel so calm and undisturbed each time I recall that my paths are not paved by me but by my Father who LEADETH ME.
It restores my soul when I know its only God alone who can be there for me when the world forsake me and everyone may run away from me it's only Jesus Christ who can lead me. Be strong in Him.

Very inspiring song. I am never my own. His faithful follower I would be, even when my life on earth is done. Every line so meaningful. And the melody is greatest - I used to sing this song in our church choir. Just fantastic!

It is so comforting that the Lord leads us.
The author of this hymn was pastor of Philadelphia's 1st Baptist Church during the Civil War. After one service, they were fellowshipping at deacon's house about the blessedness of God's leading. As others went on talking, Gilmore took out a pencil and wrote the words of this hymn, gave it to his wife, and forgot about it. 3 years later he was a pastoral candidate for a church in Rochester, NY. Since he was unfamiliar with the church's hymnal, he began leafing through it and spotted the hymn, "He Leadeth Me" - his own hymn! Without his knowledge, Mrs. Gilmore had sent the words to a Christian periodical, which had set them to music. - Great Songs of Faith by Brown and Norton.
What a Saviour we have! We can trust in His leading!
A beautiful song indeed. A beautiful act to be lead by the Almighty's own hand. He has lead me in difficult circumstances and I praise Him with this song.
Whenever I sing this song, it makes my day. I love it.

I truly love the hymn because I went through some bitter heartbreaks because I thought I was in the right way, but I realised that only the Lord leadeth me to all the good things in my life. The song comforteth me because He truly leadeth me.
I sure know Christ leads me.
The words of this hymn have blessed me immensely. How glorious that our Lord leads us! Psalm 23:2
Lovely song! Always loved it from a little girl, but I notice that it is missing the first few lines... Can this be fixed? It is such a nice song!
